meanings.definition: A parent who shares equally in the raising of a child.
meanings.sent1: My sister and her coparent work together to take care of their children.
meanings.sent2: The coparent attends all the school events and parent-teacher meetings.
meanings.sent3: The coparents decided to dress up as superheroes for their child's birthday party.
meanings.sent4: Being a coparent is like being a team player in the game of parenting.
meanings.sent5: The coparent's dedication to their child is truly admirable.

meanings.definition: To share equally in the raising of a child with another parent.
meanings.sent1: We coparent our children by dividing household chores and responsibilities.
meanings.sent2: It is important to coparent effectively for the well-being of the child.
meanings.sent3: The couple coparented their pet hamster, taking turns feeding and cleaning its cage.
meanings.sent4: Learning to coparent harmoniously requires good communication and compromise.
meanings.sent5: They decided to coparent their plants, taking turns watering them each day.
